thread.title: 'Anything Goes' is docking at the Alhambra Theater and Dining in JAX
thread.title_full: 'Anything Goes' is docking at the Alhambra Theater and Dining in JAX | Examiner.com

author: Victoria Poller
title: 'Anything Goes' is docking at the Alhambra Theater and Dining in JAX
text:
/ courtesy of the Alhambra You haven’t been disappointed before, and you won’t be left wondering what the Alhambra Theater & Dining will present next on their fine iconic stage. Cole Porter ’s musical “ Anything Goes ” is scheduled to tantalize theatre goers for the next 39 shows from October 21 through November 22, 2015.
This shining example of classical music theater , complete with amazing tap numbers (under direction of chorographer James Kinney), campy-jokes, unlikely happy endings and hummable songs like “De-Lovely,” “I Get a Kick Out Of You” and “Anything Goes,” is courtesy of the unforgettable score created by Cole Porter and locally presented by Alhambra’s producer/director, Mr. Tod Booth .
About The Show: “Anything Goes” is a musical with music and lyrics by Cole Porter. The original book was a collaborative effort by Guy Bolton and P.G. The story concerns madcap antics aboard an ocean liner bound from New York to London. Billy Crocker is a stow-away in love with heiress Hope Harcourt, who is engaged to Lord Evelyn Oakleigh. Nightclub singer Reno Sweeney and Public Enemy #13 ‘Moonface Martin’ aids Billy in his quest to win Hope. The musical introduced well-known songs such as: "Anything Goes", "You're the Top", and "I Get a Kick Out of You."
Since its 1934 debut at the Alvin Theatre (now known as the Neil Simon Theatre) on Broadway, the musical has been revived several times in the United States and Britain and has been filmed twice. The musical has long been a popular choice for school and community productions.
“ Fleet Landing ” is proud to be a friend of the Alhambra Theater & Dining while supporting and sponsoring the Jacksonville presentation of “Anything Goes”. Fleet Landing is northeast Florida's foremost destination for great retirement living. Set against the backdrop of gorgeous Lake Constellation and within walking distance to the beach, their 87-acre gated campus offers a truly unique experience among senior living communities. Fleet Landing is full of inspiration, service, care, and most of all; full of life!
Executive Chef DeJuan Roy has designed a favorable meal to coincide with the hilarity of the show. Take a look at the choices that you’ll be experiencing during this run:
First Course: White bean and country ham soup, Or Lobster salad with citrus vinaigrette on a bed of greens. *GF*
Second Course: Chicken Coq Au Vin with cheesy potato gratin and haricot vert, Or Lamb Shanks with herb mashed potatoes and candied butternut squash, Or Citrus chili roasted Mahi with yellow rice, black beans, salsa, whipped avocado and sour cream *GF-minus tortilla shell*, Or Vegetable Wellington with tomato pesto.
Third Course: Bananas Foster, Or Caramel Apple torte,
Or your choice of: *Fresh Fruit cup, Ice Cream-Chocolate or Vanilla, Sugar Free Ice Cream or chocolate mousse available at all times. *
“ Anything Goes ”
Presented by Fleet Landing
DATES: October 21 – November 22, 2015
SHOW TIMES: 8 p.m. for evening shows Tuesday through Sunday. Doors open at 5:45 p.m., and dinner will be served until 7:30 p.m. Matinees on Saturdays are at 1:15 p.m. Doors open at 11 a.m. and the brunch starts at 11:15 a.m. Sunday Matinees are at 2 p.m. Doors open at noon and the meal starts at 12:15 p.m.
DRESS: “Gala Night” (Friday October 23, 2015) attire is “Formal/Dressy”. All other shows could be “Business Casual” or “Sunday Best”.
TICKETS : Regular pricing for tickets start at $38 – $59. Ticket prices include: a plated dinner served to your table, an incredible show and prime parking. Group sales of 20 + are available upon request. Price does not include gratuity or orders from the bar.
LOCATION: Alhambra Theater & Dining
        12000 Beach Blvd .
       Jacksonville, Florida 32246
        (904) 641-1212
